data.text:
We, students of World Citi Colleges, Caloocan Campus, taking Bachelor of Science major in Tourism Management, need to make a blog about the Tourism Industry of every province near Manila and advertise it and I am assigned to do a research here in Bulacan. Join me exploring the PRIDE OF BULACAN!

History

IT’S NAME:

The name “Bulakan” was derived from the Tagalog word “bulak” which is cotton in English. When the Spaniards first came to the country’s shore, they found cotton, among others, growing abundantly in many places in Luzon, particularly in Bulakan. Others claim its name from “Bulaklakan” which means flower garden owing to the teeming flora that used to cover Bulacan – bountiful plains, mountains & trees.

Early Agustinian missionary friars were so immediately enthralled by nature’s efflorescence in Bulacan that they described it as the garden of Luzon. Modern highways, subdivisions, commercial establishments and factories have banished many glorious scenes of this floral eden, but the glory of nature still survives in many spots. Others have remained as testaments of the flowering of the arts in bygone days.

THE IMPORTANT ROLE IT PLAYED IN PHILIPPINE HISTORY:

Bulacan figures prominently in Philippine History. The glory of Philippine History bespeaks of the glory that was Bulacan. It was among the first eight provinces to take up arms against Spain as colonial power during the Philippine Revolution of 1896.

It is the home to the birth of Three Republics:

The Kakarong Republic in 1896, 1st Republic of revolutionary forces was declared. A battle site where 3000 Katipuneros died at the hands of Spanish Soldiers;

The Biak-na-Bato Republic in 1897, 2nd Republic of Gen. Emilio Aguinaldo; and

The Malolos Republic in 1898, 3rd and the most triumphant republic. This was the date when Gen. Emilio Aguinaldo convene Malolos Congress that gave birth to the 1st Philippine Constitution through the 1st Constitution Convention.

IT’S PEOPLE:

Bulacan is also known as “The Cradle of Noble Heroes”.

It is the birthplace of some of the greatest heroes of the Philippine Revolution against Spain: the greatest propagandist Marcelo H. del Pilar, Gen. Gregorio del Pilar, Anacleto Enriquez, Gen. Isidoro Torres, Maestro Eusebio Roque, Trinidad Tecson, Mariano Ponce, Maximo Viola, and other hail from Bulacan.

ARTS AND CULTURE:

“History, nationalism and culture continually surface in a tour to Bulacan.”

Countless fields sanctified by the blood of patriots. Bounties of the land celebrated in poems, paintings and songs. Mouth-watering kakanin, postres, ulam, old world pans and biscuits, longganisas and other specialities from a distant age. Beautiful ancestral houses, many of them unique. A long and enviable roster of national artists and other luminaries in the arts, and even national figures in politics.

It is difficult to arrive at a concise phrase to describe a province with such a long tradition of excellence.

These charming icons of the colonial past right at the doorstep of Manila became the lure of the province. For Filipinos whose memories of a glorious past had been rekindled by the centennial fervor, Bulacan signifies history and heritage. The province has no beaches or seaside resorts to attract the pleasure-seekers. Instead it fascinates with the richness of its culture. The abundance of traditional crafts still being created, or heirloom recipes still being cooked, of incidents in history still being told by living witnesses – these and other signs of the persistence of tradition convince the visitors that Bulakeños indeed take their cultural heritage seriously.

How, then, does one explore a provision as rich as Bulacan? Patience is needed – one cannot unravel the wealth of its heritage in one sweep.

OTHER IMPORTANT FACTS:

Land Area: 279,003 hectares

Capital: Malolos

Municipal: 22

Cities: 2

Barangay: 568

Tourist Attractions

MEYCAUAYAN

Old Malhacan Church

-400 yr. Old edifice, a mute witness of the history of Meycauayan

Gat. Ciriaco Contreras Marker

-A monument in memory of the Commander who fought in a fierce battle against Spanish soldiers in Brgy. Bangkal in Meycauayan.

Liputan Island

-Surrounded by fishponds and accessible only through water transportation

St. Francis of Assisi Church

-Religious Festival, celebration of founding of Meycauayan-October 4th

MARILAO

Divine Mercy National Shrine

Marilao Catholic Church

-17th century Roman Catholic Church

La Prenza Dam

-1989 Communal Irrigation System

Hanging Bridge

-A 60m length cable bridge. It links barrios of barangay Lambakin and barangay Sta. Rosa

Prenza Dam

-Serves as check gate to prevent water overflow from destroying rice crops in the area.

Pugpog River

Punga Dam

BOCAUE

Bocaue Museum

-Houses a collection of municipal antiques and priceless array of artifacts.

Fluvial Festival of Bocaue

-Held on the first Sunday of JULY observed in honor of the Holy Cross of Wawa. The main feature of this fiesta is the Pagoda which glides along the Bocaue River. The Pagoda is a gaily decorated structure riding on a huge banca. People from all walks of life enjoy the ride on the Pagoda feasting on sumptuous food while music plays.

STA. MARIA

Sta. Maria Church

-An Ancient 18th century church, part and parcel of Bulacan’s era that resisted the American regime.

Huseng Batute Marker

-A simple marker in honor of the country’s King of Balagtasan.

BALAGTAS

Bahay na Tisa

-One of the oldest known tiled-roof houses in the province; constructed in 1840 and exhibits mixture of mestizo, spanish and native tagalog designs.

Balagtas Monument And Museum

-The monument was built in honor of Francisco “Balagtas” Baltazar, Father of tagalog poetry, whose master piece Florante at Laura is very popular.

GUIGUINTO

Garden City

– a showcase of different plants owned and operated by a cooperative.

PLARIDEL

Battle of Quingua marker

-Death marker of Col. Strotsenberg of the Nebraska Volunteer Infantry

423-year old Parish Church

19th & 20th Century Ancestral House

PULILAN

Pulilan Carabao Festival

-Hundreds of work animals, mostly carabaos are led on a parade in the streets of the town every 14th and 15th of May to honor its patron saint, San Isidro Labrador. The carabaos decorated with garland and shaved for the occasion genuflect or kneel in front of the church.

Pulilan Butterfly Haven

-It started as a hobby of the owner, Mrs. Estelita Aguirre, former BIR Commissioner. But due to demands of tourists wanting to visit the place, it was converted into a full tourist educational destination. The old house of the owner is also open for public viewing.

BALIUAG

BALIUAG CHURCH

-As seen on the façade and interiors, the style of Baliuag church is Baroque. The church was first constructed between 1769 to 1774. The convent was erected in such a manner as to match the style of the houses in that area & era. The location & creation of the town plaza can compare to the Granja de Segovia in Spain.

BALIUAG MUSEUM

-It is the town’s center for historical and cultural heritage. Amidst the many modern edifice in the town, the century old museum was once the town’s MUNISIPYO and had witnessed the town’s successful transition from a simple barrio to what is now very progressive town. For the younger generations of Baliuag folks, it is a great pleasure to go back in time as they enjoy every visit to the town’s main existing link between the past and the present Baliuag.

LENTEN PROCESSION

-A unique procession of moving life-sized images depicting the life of Jesus Christ. It is being participated not only by Baliuageños but by people from neighboring towns as well.

SAN RAFAEL

San Rafael Catholic Church

-Site of the bloody battle between the Filipinos and the Spanish forces wherein the blood that drenched the church was ankle deep

Malangaan Cave

C & B Orchid Farm

Northwoods Golf Club, Inc.

SAN ILDEFONSO

Grotto Central Cement

-The place is memorable because of the grotto and statue of the Virgin Mary, the beautiful landscape and natural scenery.

Bulusukan

-A garrison of the “insurrectos” during the Spanish Regime.

Sand Spring

-Believed to have some medicinal values

Malangaan Cave

-Eco-tourism site, Alagao San Ildefonso

Kueba ng Grotto

SAN MIGUEL

San Miguel Old Churches

-Century old churches built by Agustinian Friars.

Nicanor Abelardo Shrine

San Miguel Old Houses:

Buencamino House – A marker honoring the leading cabinet member of the revolutionary government of Aguinaldo. As a student of UST, he led the first student activist demonstration in 1869 and put up wall posters along the Puente de Espanya.

Lipana House – originally owned by Damaso Sempio and family where Gen. Gregorio del Pilar once slept. (note: Sempio was a nephew of Gen. Gregorio del Pilar) the house is now owned by Dr. Marcelo Lipana, nephew of the wife of Don Damaso Sempio.

Viola House – The original owner is Dr. Maximo Viola, companion of Dr. Jose Rizal in Europe by the time the later was writing his two famous novels, the El Filibusterismo and Noli Me Tangere.

Doña Narcisa B. de Leon House – Owned by Doña Sisang of LVN pictures. Her two grandchildren are film director Mike de Leon and Ambassador Narcisa “Ching” de Leon Escaler. This is the ancestral Home of former Cong. Jose “Boji” Cabochan The grandfather of the former Congressman Don Felix de Leon, a close friend of Dr. Jose Rizal

TECSON, MOSESGOLD,SIOJO HOUSE , TRINIDAD SUJECO OLD HOUSE SEVILLA DE LEON MANSION, NICANOR ABELARDO SHRINE

ECO-TOURISM SITES:

Biak na Bato National Park

– A huge split boulder which is a mountain hideout of the revolutionary forces during the Spanish regime and the place where the Malolos Constitution was signed by Gen. Aguinaldo and Pedro Paterno of the Biak-na-Bato rep.

It was declared as a National Park by the late President Manuel L. Quezon in 1937. It is a living witness during the revolutionary era where Filipino revolutionaries fought against the Spaniards.

The nest of freedom fighters during the Philippine–Spanish war, appeals to the adventurous spirit with its challenging rock formations. Today, hanging bridges and staircases connect rivers and caves for a more pleasurable exploration.
